    Class and Description
    AbstractCentroidCluster
    A cluster, i.e.
    AbstractCluster 
    AbstractClusteringMethod 
    AdditiveCentroidCluster
    A cluster whose centroid can be moved by adding or removing individual samples.
    AdditiveClusterable
    Interface for classes that can be clustered, and that have the property that the centroid of a set of objects is simply the sum of the objects.
    BasicBatchCluster
    Explicitly stores all the points in a cluster.
    BatchCluster 
    BatchClusteringMethod
    A clustering method that needs the complete set of samples on hand in order to operate.
    CentroidCluster
    A cluster, i.e.
    CentroidClusteringMethod
    A clustering method which represents each cluster as a point (the "centroid"), which must be generated from a prototype and which has various stats associated with it
    Cluster 
    Clusterable
    Primarily a marker interface for classes that can be clustered by various algorithms.
    ClusterableDoubleArray 
    ClusterableIterator
    Interface for resettable iterators over Clusterable objects.
    ClusterableIteratorFactory
    A Factory for new Iterators based on a Collection.
    ClusterException
    An exception having to do with clustering.
    ClusteringMethod 
    ClusteringTestResults
    Encapsulates the probability histograms of test samples classified correctly, incorrectly, or not at all.
    ClusterList
    Interface for objects that contain a list of Clusters.
    ClusterMove
    Represents a potential move of a sample from one cluster to another.
    NoGoodClusterException
    An exception thrown when no satisfactory cluster is found for a sample.
    OnlineClusteringMethod 
    PointClusterFilter 
    ProhibitionModel 
    SimpleClusterable 
    SupervisedClusteringMethod 
    UnsupervisedClusteringMethod
